div1.p: IN THE MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF MOOLA SINGH AND SEVENTY-TWO HINDOO ALIENS

Come now the petitioners and request the Court to grant a rehearing and further, to stay the deporta- tion of the aliens and the signing of the final judg- ment until the petitioners have had an opportunity to be heard.

In the advance sheets for this year the latest word on the subject has been said by the Supreme Court of the United States in the advance sheets for January, 1913, No. 3, the case of Zakonaite vs. Wolf, decided in December of 1912, in which the contention of the petition- ers is apparently sustained in that the Court states in that opinion that the facts must be adequate to support the secretary's conclusions, which shows clearly that there was no finality as has been contended. Also in a case decided in June 1912, the supreme Court of the United States lays dovn a different doctrine to that advanced by the Government and different to that supporting the
ruling of the Honorable Court. These, with other late cases, it is the desire of attorney for petitioners, to call to the attention of this Honorable Court.

It will be noted from the attached clipping,
SEATTLE COURT RULING AFFECTS MANY HINDUS
Orientals in San Francisco Will BE Deported Under Decision Made by Federal Judge in This City.
WASHINGTON, Friday, Sept. 12- Hindues seeking admission to the United States through the Philippines, or any other American possession, will not be permitted to land, unless they pass the examination required under the immigration laws.
Commissioner General of Immigration Caminetti received word last night from the immigration commissioner at Seattle that the federal court there had sustained his order deporting seventy- three Hindus who recently arrived from the Philippines. The commissioner ordered them deported "on the ground that they were unlawfully within the United States because at the time of their entry to the Philippines they were likely to become public charges if they should come to the mainland of the United States."
Twenty or more similar cases are pending at San Francisco and the Hindus probably will be ordered deported under the decision of the court. there are aliens in other portions of our country, lestinies are being determined by the decision of onorable Court and therefore, as this is the first case of this sort has been before the Federal every precaution should be taken to have no committed and to have every opportunity given eys for petitioners and the government.

It will be further noted that the cases cited government and also by this Honorable Court, that in each case it was either admitted by the aline or was definitely proven that they were actual law violators, which is not the case in issue here.

This petition is based on the fact that the matter of finality of the decision of the immigration department was but lightly touched upon in the hearing on the application for the writ, owing to the size of the record and the number of different phases of the case, and further for the reason that the petitoners believe that there is a distinction in the present case from those cited by the Honorable Judge of the District Court in his opinion, which the petitioners desire to call the court's attention to. Further, petitioners believe that there are later decisions which would be taken as authoritive by this Honorable Court than those cited by
counsel for the government, and further, certain matters have been suggested by the opinion of this Honorable Court.
WHEREFORE petitioners pray that they may be given leave to present these matters to the Honorable District Court before judgement is finally signed.
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTION, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE UNLAWFUL DETENTION OF 73 HINDOO ALIENS.
Received Copy of Within Sept 12, 1913 EBBrockway Asst U.S Atty
FILED IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT, WESTERN DIST. OF WASHINGTON, SEP 13 1913 FRANK L. CROSBY, CLERK, By Emy Deputy
HERBERT W. MEYERS ATTORNEY AT LAW 430-431-432-433 PIONEER BUILDING PHONE MAIN 1278 SEATTLE, WASH. MERCHANTS PRINTING CO., TIMES BLDG., SEATTLE
